original: Frisk, Karl Erik Teodor, läroverksadjunkt, Halmstad, f. 30/3/97 i Linköp. av Carl F. o. Anna Lind. G. 32 m. Mimi Boeck. Barn: Monica f. 33, Bertil 37, Thomas 41. — Stud:ex. i Linköp. 16, fil. kand. i Upps. 20, fil. mag. 24, fil. lic. 40. Stud. v. Karls-univ. i Prag s. tjeckoslov. undivisn:-min. stip. 24-25, lektor i sv. spr. v. samma univ. 37-38. Res. t. Frarikr. 22, 23, 30 o. 31, Span. 23, Tyskl. 22, 25 o. 34, Tjecko-silov. 26, 27, 28, 29, 36, 47, Jugo’slav. 25 o. 28, Bulg., Grekl. o. Turk. 28, Österr. 29, 31 o. 36, Ital. 29, Engl. o. Irland 31. Ämneslär. v. Solbacka lärov. 26-36, adj. i tyska o. franska v. Halmstads h. a. 1. sed. 36. Ordf. i All. Frangaise i Halmstad sed. 39, Radiotjänsts om’b. i Halmstad sed. 44. Skr.: övers. fr. tjeck., bl. a. Karei Capek: Ett år m. min trädgård, Meteor, Hordubail, Salamanderkriget; Arne Novàk: Tjeck. litt. i fågelperspektiv, Barockens Prag; Emil Vachek: Hönsastegen; Egon Hostovsky: Sju gånger i huvudroiBen; Cadik-Vanek: Prins Eugen; fr. tjeck. o. slovak, t. tyska Svanda-Loubal, Czecho-Slova-kia i Report on Nationalism in Hist. Textbooks, utg. av Univ. Christ. Con-ference on Life and Work; fr. eng. H. Cobb: På ärans fält. RTjslVLO.
translated: Frisk, Karl Erik Teodor, high school teacher, Halmstad, born March 30th, 1897 in Linköping to Carl F. and Anna Lind. Married to Mimi Boeck in 1932. They have three children: Monica born in 1933, Bertil born in 1937, and Thomas born in 1941. He completed his secondary school education in Linköping in 1916 and obtained a bachelor's degree from Uppsala University in 1920, a Master's degree in 1924, and a Ph.D. in 1940. He studied at Charles University in Prague with a Czechoslovakia undivided-minority scholarship from 1924-25 and was a Swedish language lecturer at the same university from 1937-38. He travelled to France in 1922, 1923, 1930, and 1931, Spain in 1923, Germany in 1922, 1925, and 1934, Czechoslovakia in 1926, 1927, 1928, 1929, 1936, 1947, Yugoslavia in 1925 and 1928, Bulgaria, Greece, and Turkey in 1928, Austria 1929, 1931, and 1936, Italy in 1929, and England and Ireland in 1931. He worked as a subject teacher at Solbacka high school from 1926-36 and as a teacher of German and French at Halmstad secondary school from 1936 onwards. He served as the chairman of the Alliance Francaise in Halmstad from 1939 and as the Radio Services Representative in Halmstad from 1944. He has translated Czech literature, including works by Karei Capek, Arne Novák, Emil Vachek, Egon Hostovsky, and Cadik-Vanek, from Czech and Slovak into Swedish and from German into Swedish. He has also translated Svanda-Loubal's works from Czech into German and Czechoslovakia in Report on Nationalism in Hist. Textbooks from Czech and Slovak into English. He published the translated work of H. Cobb, 'On the Field of Honor.'

structured.name: Karl Erik Teodor Frisk
